  • Constructor Details

    • EventServiceImpl

      @Autowired public EventServiceImpl(EventRepository eventRepository, ArtistRepository artistRepository, FeaturedEventRepository featuredEventRepository, TicketCategoryRepository ticketCategoryRepository, TicketPricingRepository ticketPricingRepository, EventDtoMapper eventDTOMapper, ArtistDtoMapper artistDtoMapper, AmazonS3Service amazonS3Service, EmailService emailService, TicketRepository ticketRepository, SectionDtoMapper sectionDtoMapper)
      Constructs an instance of EventServiceImpl with the specified dependencies. This constructor is used for dependency injection to set various repositories, mappers, services, and other dependencies required for managing events in the application.
      Parameters:
      eventRepository - The EventRepository to interact with event data.
      artistRepository - The ArtistRepository to interact with artist data.
      featuredEventRepository - The FeaturedEventRepository to manage featured events.
      ticketCategoryRepository - The TicketCategoryRepository to work with ticket categories.
      ticketPricingRepository - The TicketPricingRepository to manage ticket pricing information.
      eventDTOMapper - The EventDtoMapper for mapping Event entities to DTOs.
      artistDtoMapper - The ArtistDtoMapper for mapping Artist entities to DTOs.
      amazonS3Service - The AmazonS3Service for interacting with Amazon S3 storage.
      emailService - The EmailService for sending emails.
      ticketRepository - The TicketRepository for ticket-related operations.
      sectionDtoMapper - The SectionDtoMapper for mapping section details to DTOs.

    • addArtistToEvent

      public EventDisplayDto addArtistToEvent(Integer artistId, Integer eventId)
      Adds an artist to an event.
      Specified by:
      addArtistToEvent in interface EventService
      Parameters:
      artistId - The ID of the artist to be added.
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the artist should be added.
      Returns:
      An EventDisplayDto representing the updated event with the artist added.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If either the artist with the specified ID or the event with the specified ID does not exist in the database.
      AlreadyExistsException - If the artist is already linked to the stated event.
      See Also:

    • addTicketCategory

      public EventDisplayDto addTicketCategory(Integer catId, Integer eventId, Double price)
      Adds a ticket category to an event with the specified price.
      Specified by:
      addTicketCategory in interface EventService
      Parameters:
      catId - The ID of the ticket category to be added.
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the ticket category should be added.
      price - The price for the ticket category.
      Returns:
      The updated event with the newly added ticket category.
      Throws:
      AlreadyExistsException - if the ticket category is already linked to the event.
      NonExistentException - if the ticket category or event does not exist.
      See Also:

      Specified by:
      updateTicketPricing in interface EventService
      Parameters:
      catId - The ID of the ticket category to be updated.
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the ticket category is linked.
      price - The new price for the ticket category.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - if the ticket category or event does not exist, or if the ticket category is not linked to the event.

    • removeTicketCategory

      public EventDisplayDto removeTicketCategory(Integer catId, Integer eventId)
      Removes a ticket category from an event, effectively unlinking it.
      Specified by:
      removeTicketCategory in interface EventService
      Parameters:
      catId - The ID of the ticket category to be removed from the event.
      eventId - The ID of the event from which the ticket category should be removed.
      Returns:
      The updated event information after removing the ticket category.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - if the ticket category is not linked to the event, or if either the category or the event does not exist.
